ingredients:
• Large garlic bread
• Ginger-garlic paste - 1 tsp
• Tomato chopped - 1 cup
• Cucumber chopped - 1 cup
• Onion chopped - 1 cup
• Carrot chopped - 1/2 cup
• Babycorn - 1/2 cup
• Red chilli - 1/2 tsp
• Pepper - 1/2 tsp
• Coriander Powder - 1 tsp
• mustard - 1/2 tsp
• Cumin roast - 1/2 tsp
• Turmeric - 1/2 tsp
• Tomato Sauce - 2 tsp
• Chaat masala - a small spoon
• Salt - as per taste
• Oil or Ghee - 1 tsp
procedure:
• Cut garlic bread and keep aside.
• Add oil to a pan and add mustard seeds.
•  Add ginger-garlic paste and fry a little, then add onion and fry.
• Add all the spices, salt except the vegetables and chaat masala and let it cook on low heat for five minutes.
• Turn off the gas and apply this spice by applying butter to the grind of garlic bread and add chaat masala on top and cook it in the oven for ten minutes at 180 centigrade. If there is no oven, the gas can also be used to cook using a frying pan.
• You can also put cheese on it.
